tr.metin:
Cengiz Sarıkuş’u altı yıl önce udumu yaptırmak için gittiğim Fındıkzade’deki atölyesinde tanıdım. 1949’da Malatya’da doğmuş, İstanbul Üniversitesi Sanat Tarihi Bölümünü bitirmiş, 26 yıl sanat tarihi öğretmenliği yapmış.

Oğlu Veysel’in ismini taşıyan müzik evinde ud, tambur, kemençe, bağlama, keman, cümbüş gibi birçok enstrüman üretiyorlar. Cengiz Usta bu sanatı Ermeni ud yapım ekolünün son temsilcisi Agop Ohanyan gibi ustalardan öğrenmiş. İlk atölyesini 1973 yılında Aksaray’da açmış. Bugüne kadar dünyanın dört bir yanında çalışan birçok usta yetiştirmiş, son kalfası ise oğlu Veysel.

en.metin:
I met Cengiz Sarıkuş in his workshop in Fındıkzade, where I went to have my oud done six years ago. He was born in Malatya, in 1949, graduated from Istanbul University Art History Department and had been an art history teacher for 26 years.

They produce many instruments such as oud, drum, bağlama, violin, and cümbüş in the music house named after his son Veysel. Cengiz learned this art from masters such as Agop Ohanyan, the last representative of the Armenian oud making school. He opened his first workshop in Aksaray in 1973. He has trained many masters working all over the world so far, and his last apprentice is his son Veysel.

ozgecmis.metin: Born in Talas -Kayseri. She graduated from ITU Mathematics Engineering, Computer Programmer. She likes to take photos with a story. She thinks that “A song that you listen to sometimes makes you sad, sometimes happy, and if it conveys the composer's emotion to you, it should convey that feeling to you in photography”. She participated ; 2009 December “Portrait in White”, 2014 “Torluk”, April 2018 “Someone Among Us” and in 2018 “Efod Yedi Lakes Fall” exhibitions.
